definitions.definition: In or at a place or location (stated, implied or otherwise indicated) that is perceived to be away from, or at a relative distance from, the speaker ( compare here ).
examples: I know Bristol quite well as I used to live there .
I looked in the cupboard and my keys were there !
The air there is beneficial to health.
I consulted Wikipedia, and it says there that he died in 1970.
The view up here is better than the view down there !
There ' s that book I've been looking for!

subdefinitions.definition: At that point, stage, etc., visualised as a distinct place.
examples: He did not stop there , but continued his speech.
They patched up their differences, but matters did not end there .

subdefinitions.definition: In a notional place where one will provide support or care; see also be there .
examples: You know that I will always be there for you.
I know that aliens are there , somewhere.

subdefinitions.definition: In its correct position, so as to be fully and properly fitted or inserted.
examples: If I just push this in here like this, it should .... Ah! Good! It's there !

subdefinitions.definition: After the name of a person perceived as located 'away' from the speaker, used familiarly to indicate that person.
examples: Jim there has been with the company for twenty years.

subdefinitions.definition: After certain determiners, especially 'them', 'that' and 'those', used to emphasise demonstrative sense; see also them there .
examples: Your dog's been a-chasin' those there chickens.

subdefinitions.definition: In a notional place or situation of mental soundness and competence; see also all there .
examples: I spoke to her, but she didn't make much sense. I don't think she's totally there .

definitions.definition: To or into a place or location; thither .
examples: I've never been to Disneyland. Can we go there ?

subdefinitions.definition: Into an undesirable topic or subject matter; see also go there .
examples: He started to talk about ... you know ... and I told him please don't go there .
You say that the president is a crook, and I certainly agree with you there .

definitions.definition: Where , there where, in which place.
In this world: used to say that someone or something exists ; see also pronoun section below .

main_definition: ( location ) In or at a place or location (stated, implied or otherwise indicated) that is perceived to be away from, or at a relative distance from, the speaker ( compare here ).
secondary_definitions: ( location ) To or into a place or location; thither .
( figuratively ) In that matter, relation, etc..
( obsolete ) Where , there where, in which place.
In this world: used to say that someone or something exists ; see also pronoun section below .
